abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Multi-Country
            Capacity-Building for Compliance with the Cartagena Protocol
            on Biosafety Project for Latin America is to strengthen the
            capacity in the four participating countries to implement
            the Cartagena protocol on biosafety. Specifically, it aims
            to strengthen the technical capacity in knowledge generation
            for biosafety risk assessment and management; and strengthen
            the biosafety decision-making capacity. The closing date of
            the project will be extended from June 30, 2011 until June
            30, 2012. The need for extension has been discussed within
            the project teams comprising the regional coordinator, the
            four national coordinators and the thematic leaders. There
            is a consensus that a one year extension is required for the
            following reasons. Declaration of effectiveness was delayed
            by almost 6 months. This in turn caused a delay in the first
            disbursement for project activities (on June 20, 2009), as
            well as in the signing of the legal agreements between the
            regional and the national implementing institutions, and
            participating entities. Consequently, project activities
            (through subprojects) that depend on an agricultural
            calendar and crop biological processes, such as planting and
            harvesting seasons, will need to continue beyond the current
            closing date.
